DataElement.preferredName: Smokeless Tobacco Regular User Average Per Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of how many times per day an individual regularly using smokeless tobacco for at least six weeks chewed or used snuff.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Smokeless Tobacco Greater Than or Equal To Six Week Average Per Day Regular Usage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._Any period of seven consecutive days._A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data._A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours._Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.

Concepts.definition: Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Six Week Average Per Day Regular Usage

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A statistical calculation describing the central tendency of a set of numbers; used to interpret quantitative data.
A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.
Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient used smokeless
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient used smokeless tobacco (including chewing tobacco and snuff) regularly for at least six weeks, on average how many times per day did they use?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-Phase-3-Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient used smokeless tobacco (including chewing tobacco and snuff) regularly for at least six weeks, on average how many times per day did they use?
